communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

 I apologize for any misunderstanding. To confirm, this FOIA request is distinct from previous ones, as I’m seeking empty templates of forms utilized by the Stamford Police Department for citizens to obtain Freedom of Information records, rather than completed forms over an extended period. If  further clarification is needed, please feel free to let me know.

 Please be so kind as to provide blank versions of any paper or electronic forms used by the City of Stamford Police Department from January 1, 2019, to July 15, 2023, for citizens making Freedom of Information requests. One copy of each form version, if multiple versions exist, will be adequate to fulfill this inquiry.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.
Police
Sincerely,

Robert Meehan

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: VCCP Patient Safety Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All complaints, reports, and patient safety data -- including Serious Reportable Events, Hospital Acquired Conditions as reported to the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services, and Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality Patient Safety Indicators -- for provider associated with the VA's Veteran Community Care Program (VCCP).

Much of this data is collected through the department's third party administrators, including TriWest and Optum. Please also provide the Clinical Quality Monitoring Plans implemented by the TPAs, which are required to include quality monitoring activities for patient safety, clinical quality assurance, clinical quality improvement, and peer review. Finally please provide all information, mandated under federal contracts, that TPAs collect in their efforts to identify, track, trend, and report interventions to resolve any potential or identified quality issues. 

The creation and collection of this information is detailed in recent Congressional testimony here:

https://docs.house.gov/meetings/VR/VR03/20220714/114988/HHRG-117-VR03-Wstate-LaPuzM-20220714-U1.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jasper Craven
